meanings.definition: Of or relating to a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The royal family's clothing had a monarchal design.
meanings.sent2: The crown had a monarchal symbol engraved on it.
meanings.sent3: The monarchal robe was so heavy, it made the king stumble.
meanings.sent4: The grand palace exuded a monarchal aura of power and authority.
meanings.sent5: The monarchal decree echoed through the halls, commanding attention.

meanings.sent1: The luxurious throne had a monarchal appearance.
meanings.sent2: The monarchal behavior of the queen impressed the courtiers.
meanings.sent3: The monarchal crown sparkled in the sunlight, dazzling all who beheld it.
meanings.sent4: His monarchal demeanor demanded respect from all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The monarchal presence filled the room, silencing any whispers of dissent.

meanings.definition: Supporting or advocating for a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The loyal subjects displayed their monarchal allegiance with pride.
meanings.sent2: The monarchal supporters cheered for the king's speech.
meanings.sent3: The monarchal banners waved high in the air, showing unwavering loyalty.
meanings.sent4: Her monarchal beliefs led her to defend the king against all opposition.
meanings.sent5: The monarchal followers stood united, unwavering in their devotion to the crown.
